/** 
 * Compare Erf.erfc against reference values computed using GCC 4.2.1 (Apple OSX packaged version) erfcl (extended precision erfc).
 */
@Test public void testErfcGnu(){
  final double tol=1E-15;
  final double[] gnuValues=new double[]{2,2,2,2,2,2,2,2,1.9999999999999999785,1.9999999999999926422,1.9999999999984625402,1.9999999998033839558,1.9999999845827420998,1.9999992569016276586,1.9999779095030014146,1.9995930479825550411,1.9953222650189527342,1.9661051464753107271,1.8427007929497148695,1.5204998778130465381,1,0.47950012218695346194,0.15729920705028513051,0.033894853524689272893,0.0046777349810472658333,0.00040695201744495893941,2.2090496998585441366E-05,7.4309837234141274516E-07,1.5417257900280018858E-08,1.966160441542887477E-10,1.5374597944280348501E-12,7.3578479179743980661E-15,2.1519736712498913103E-17,3.8421483271206474691E-20,4.1838256077794144006E-23,2.7766493860305691016E-26,1.1224297172982927079E-29,2.7623240713337714448E-33,4.1370317465138102353E-37,3.7692144856548799402E-41,2.0884875837625447567E-45};
  double x=-10d;
  for (int i=0; i < 41; i++) {
    Assert.assertEquals(gnuValues[i],Erf.erfc(x),tol);
    x+=0.5d;
  }
}
